column4: and it appears to be running, just with not so many features?
choose custom
if you don't have it: sudo apt-get install compizconfig-settings-manager
chooise custom?
if you have the settings manager, you can choose between none, normal, extra and custom
I'm on gutsy and can only see none, normal and extra.
if you don't have it: sudo apt-get install compizconfig-settings-manager
Just done that, I'm looking for it now :P
Ok, so I found that, but when I try and open it, the screen jigs, and nothing happens?
you have an ATI gfx card, i presume?
yes.
umm, go to System->Administration->Restricted Drivers Manager
is your card there?
enable it
I want to enable it?
Then what? Restart X?
it should ask for a restart
ok, I've done that, and custom has appeared. However, when I choose custom I get an error saying Composite Extension isn't available?
hm, check if the drivers are enabled
in the restricted drivers manager
hold on a sec
run "compiz --replace" in a terminal and paste the output in www.pastebin.com
no need for pastebin; No whitelisted driver found; aborting and using fallback: /usr/bin/metacity
http://wiki.compiz-fusion.org/Hardware/Blacklist
